quoteFirst: My best wishes, Mlle. Suzanne, and kind regards to M. Philippe." He took a heavy gold hunter from his pocket. "M. Gerbois, it is now
quoteLast: : I authorize you to leave this room at fourteen minutes to four.... Not a moment before fourteen minutes to four....
title:
The Blonde Lady
Being a Record of the Duel of Wits between Arsène Lupin and the English Detective
author: Leblanc, Maurice, 1864-1941

quoteFirst: At 15:42, as Rawolle named it, but at
quoteLast: , as Cobb persisted in calling it, their arrangements had been completed and they were at the front entrance to the Occidental.
title: A. D. 2000
author: Fuller, Alvarado M. (Alvarado Mortimer), 1851-1924; Bretsnyder, W. [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: Our trunk going to Yarmouth seems to be down, as well as the telegraphs. Yarmouth, Lowestoft, and beyond Beccles seem all to have been suddenly cut off. About
quoteLast: the operators noticed something wrong, switched the trunks through to the testers, and the latter reported to me in due course.”
title: The Invasion of 1910, with a full account of the siege of London
author: Le Queux, William, 1864-1927

quoteFirst: ; and on the 29th sets at 11:28 p. m. It is farthest from the earth on the 13th at 1:30 p. m.; and nearest to the earth on the 26th at
quoteLast: In latitude 41° 30′ north, its least elevation above the horizon is on the 15th, and its greatest on the 28th; on the former date being 29° 48½′, and on the latter 67° 12½′. There will also be a total eclipse, beginning on the 10th at 4:44 a. m., and ending at 8:33 a. m.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, April 1884, No. 7
